definitions.definition: (chiefly in the plural) That which is left; relic; remainder.
(in the plural) That which is left of a human being after the life is gone; relics; a dead body.
Posthumous works or productions, especially literary works.

To stay behind while others withdraw; to be left after others have been removed or destroyed; to be left after a number or quantity has been subtracted or cut off; to be left as not included or comprised.
To continue unchanged in place, form, or condition, or undiminished in quantity; to abide; to stay; to endure; to last.
definitions.example: There was no food in the house, so I had to remain hungry.

definitions.definition: To await; to be left to.
To continue in a state of being.
definitions.example: The light remained red for two full minutes.

definitions.definition: What is left after a person (or any organism) dies; a corpse.
definitions.example: The victim's remains were one small piece of bone.

definitions.definition: The extant writings of a deceased person.
definitions.example: To his great intellectual powers his published remains bear abundant witness.

definitions.definition: All that is left of the stock of some things; remnants.
definitions.example: He couldn't bring himself to eat the remains of the chicken dinner.
